results.title: Uvalde Teacher Spoke With Husband, a Police Officer, Before She Died
results.abstract: Eva Mireles’s husband was an officer with the school district’s Police Department. But he was not allowed to enter the place where his wife and her students were under attack.

media.caption: Eva Mireles, who taught fourth graders at Robb Elementary School, was one of 21 victims.

results.title: Sabrina’s Parents Love Her. But the Meltdowns Are Too Much.
results.abstract: Unpredictable violence, chaotic outbursts and countless trips to the emergency room. What happens when an autistic teenager becomes unmanageable at home?

media.copyright: Libby March for The New York Times

results.title: Coffee Drinking Linked to Lower Mortality Risk, New Study Finds
results.abstract: The research found that those who drank moderate amounts of coffee, even with a little sugar, were up to 30 percent less likely to die during the study period than those who didn’t drink coffee.

media.copyright: Aileen Son for The New York Times

results.title: Doctors Transplant Ear of Human Cells, Made by 3-D Printer
results.abstract: 3DBio Therapeutics, a biotech company in Queens, said it had for the first time used 3-D printing to make a body part with a patient’s own cells.

media.caption: Alexa, the patient, before the surgery, left, and 30 days after the surgery.

results.title: The Actual Malice of the Johnny Depp Trial
results.abstract: In this post-#MeToo moment, misogyny and celebrity go hand in hand.

media.caption: Even before the verdict came in, Depp had already won. What had looked like a clear-cut case of domestic violence had devolved into a “both sides” melodrama.

results.title: Johnny Depp Jury Finds That Amber Heard Defamed Him in Op-Ed
results.abstract: The jury in Virginia found that Ms. Heard had damaged her ex-husband’s reputation with an op-ed in which she identified herself as a “public figure representing domestic abuse.”

media.caption: The libel case that pitted Johnny Depp against his ex-wife Amber Heard lasted six weeks.

results.title: $5.8 Billion in Loans Will Be Forgiven for Corinthian Colleges Students
results.abstract: The Education Department said it would wipe out the debts of 560,000 borrowers who had enrolled in the for-profit college chain, which collapsed in 2015.

results.title: Do Swedish People Feed Their Guests?
results.abstract: After a Reddit post brought an unusual Swedish dining custom to light, Nordic people are trying to explain why they won’t share the pickled herring.

results.title: KK, Singer of Bollywood Hits, Dies at 53 After a Concert
results.abstract: He had just concluded a performance when he was stricken. Nicknamed “the Mesmerizer,” he recorded hundreds of songs for some of India’s biggest movie stars.

media.caption: KK performing in 2018 in New Delhi. Millions of young Indians took to social media after his death in an outpouring of grief.
media.copyright: Sarang Gupta/Hindustan Times via Getty Images
